programs.name: WELL Building Standard v2 - Biophilia Preconditions
programs.outcome: Requires nature incorporation in certified buildings; over 4,000 projects registered globally by 2023
programs.source: International WELL Building Institute (wellcertified.com) - UNVERIFIED, requires web access to confirm current numbers

programs.name: Singapore Green Building Masterplan
programs.outcome: Target 80% of buildings green-certified by 2030, includes biophilic design requirements
programs.source: Building and Construction Authority Singapore - UNVERIFIED

statistics.claim: Workers in offices with natural elements reported 15% higher wellbeing
Views of nature from workplace associated with 6% higher productivity

studies.authors: Browning, W., Ryan, C., Clancy, J.
studies.title: 14 Patterns of Biophilic Design
studies.finding: Identified 14 patterns linking nature exposure in buildings to stress reduction, cognitive performance, and mood enhancement

studies.title: The Practice of Biophilic Design
studies.finding: Framework connecting biophilic design elements to documented health outcomes including reduced blood pressure and improved attention

examples.description: Amazon Spheres - 40,000 plants from 30 countries, workplace designed around living plant systems
examples.source: Amazon corporate communications - outcome data not independently verified

examples.description: Apple Park - 9,000 trees, natural ventilation, extensive daylight access in workplace design
examples.source: Apple Inc. - outcome data not independently verified

notes: IMPORTANT CAVEAT: I was unable to perform web searches or fetch current sources in this session. The citations above are from my training data and could not be verified as current or accurate. The biophilic workplace pattern has substantial research support in my training data (Terrapin Bright Green, Human Spaces, WELL Standard), but specific statistics and outcomes should be independently verified before inclusion in a published pattern. The 2015 Human Spaces report is frequently cited but is now dated. More recent studies may exist but could not be searched.
